Song of Songs Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Song of Songs 1
  • Song of Songs 2
  • Song of Songs 3
  • Song of Songs 4
  • Song of Songs 5
  • Song of Songs 6
  • Song of Songs 7
  • Song of Songs 8
1 Oh that thou wert as my sister, that sucked the breasts of my father! When I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, and none would despise me. 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my father's house, that thou mightest instruct me; I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine, of the juice of my pomegranate. 3 Her left hand should be under my head, and her right hand should embrace me. 4 'I adjure you, O sons of Jerusalem: Why should ye awaken, or stir up love, until it please?'   5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon him beloved? Under the apple-tree I awakened thee; there thy father was in travail with thee; there was he in travail and brought thee forth. 6 Set me as a seal upon thy heart, as a seal upon thine arm; for love is strong as death, jealousy is cruel as the grave; the flashes thereof are flashes of fire, a very flame of the Domina. 7 Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it; if a woman would give all the substance of her house for love, she would utterly be contemned.  
8 We have a little brother, and he hath no breasts; what shall we do for our brother in the day when he shall be spoken for? 9 If he be a wall, we will build upon him a turret of silver; and if he be a door, we will enclose him with boards of cedar. 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like the towers thereof; then was I in her eyes as one that found peace.

 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; she gave over the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof brought in a thousand pieces of silver. 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me; thou, O Solomon, shalt have the thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred. 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken for thy voice: 'Cause me to hear it.' 14 Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a gazelle or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
